quote_first: He scrolled through [the emails], mentally dismissing the vast majority as low priority, but one in particular triggered his curiosity: it was from Art Bullock, sent at
quote_last: The subject line read: URGENT FOR FRIDAY MORNING.
quote_raw: He scrolled through [the emails], mentally dismissing the vast majority as low priority, but one in particular triggered his curiosity: it was from Art Bullock, sent at 2:15 a.m. The subject line read: URGENT FOR FRIDAY MORNING.
title: The Ambition
author: Lee Strobel

quote_first: It was the middle of the night when the phone rang. He opened his eyes to find the clock reading
quote_last: . At first he was too groggy to grasp why a bell might be ringing nearby, but he shook his head and, almost unconsciously, picked up the receiver and held it to his ear.
quote_raw: It was the middle of the night when the phone rang. He opened his eyes to find the clock reading 2:15. At first he was too groggy to grasp why a bell might be ringing nearby, but he shook his head and, almost unconsciously, picked up the receiver and held it to his ear.
title: Blind Willow, Sleeping Woman
author: Haruki Murakami

quote_last: a policeman observed the place in darkness, but with the stranger's motor still at the curb.
quote_raw: At 2.15 am a policeman observed the place in darkness, but with the stranger's motor still at the curb.
title: The Shadow Out of Time
author: H.P. Lovecraft

quote_first: It did. When the alarm rang at
quote_last: , Lew shut it off, snapped on the little bedside lamp, then swung his feet to the floor to sit on the edge of the bed, holding his eyes open.
quote_raw: It did. When the alarm rang at two fifteen, Lew shut it off, snapped on the little bedside lamp, then swung his feet to the floor to sit on the edge of the bed, holding his eyes open.
title: The Night People
author: Jack Finney
